goal.en: Introduce quantum phenomena which are related to the quantum computation and quantum information. Current technology is beginning to allow people to manipulate rather than just observe individual quantum phenomena. This opens up the possibility of exploiting quantum effects to perform computations beyond the scope of any classical computer. This course discusses how quantum technologies apply in the information science. What is the structure of a quantum computer? How to develop an efficient algorithm for factoring whole number efficiently? From this course, students can own the basic knowledge and applications of a quantum computer.
goal.ch: 講授量子科技基本知識，解釋量子基本原理與理論，介紹量子物理的數學工具，加強學生對於量子物理現象及其理論的了解，建立學生獨立思考與基本概念，藉由量子物理的了解以增強學生邏輯觀念，進而培養學生自然觀與世界觀，使學生具備未來量子科技應用所需之知識，提供學生追求高深學術研究的基礎，兼顧應用與學術研究之知識，帶動國家與社會之科技發展。

content.en:

2. Photons and Electrons

7. Hilbert Space
8. Operators on Hilbert Space
9. Midterm Examination
10. Classical and Reversible Gates
11. Quantum Gats
12. Entanglement and Quantum Teleportation
13. Deutch-Josza Algorithm
14. Quantum Fourier Transformation
15. Simon and Shor’s Algorithm
16. Grover’s algorithm
17. Quantum cryptography
18. Final Examination
